channel.title: [317] Changing ground Texture Colour/Create your own GW Area UPDATED PIX
channel.description:
Welcome!: [IMG]http://img200.imageshack.us/img200/466/090905161146.png[/img]
Difficulty 1/10 (depends on your patience and lack of the ability to double click and select the white colour)
Equipment needed to use this: -Tom's Cache editor - http://www.nuke-net.com/?page_id=5 mirror 2: http://uppit.com/v/OXZC027G -Your Client -Your Cache
Step 1 - Loading your cache onto Tom's Cache Editor:
-Loading your cache onto Tom's Cache Editor is very easy, no skill required, simply Open the editor, and a small screen SHOULD pop up. An easy route to get to open this is Cache-Suit>Trunk>Suite>Open Suite.jar. [IMG]http://img200.imageshack.us/img200/1778/090905163435.png[/img]
Step 2 - Using the Cache editor
-Now at the top right, click, File, Load Cache, now go to your client, open client, then cache,now "OPEN" .file_store32, and now some option should open up on the editor such as "view/edit raw file system".
[IMG]http://img200.imageshack.us/img200/8859/090905163732.png[/img]
[IMG]http://img200.imageshack.us/img200/9384/090905163459.png[/img]
-The one you want to click is quite obvious, View/Edit Floor Configuration, by the bottom.
Step 3 - Changing the Floor colour
Time for the fun part!
Now you should see a whooole bunch of options, cliff, cliff2, etc, every colour you see that looks gererally like the colour of the ground you want to change, click it and set then double click "colour" it might take a few times, till it becomes unhighlighed, then at the end you should see a "..." and a "x", click the "..." and a small screen will popup for quick changing, on the right hand side, where it says recent, just click any of those boxes to set the colour to white. Simply click ok, and continue.
[IMG]http://img200.imageshack.us/img200/3034/090905163802.png[/img]
I Suggest you change all the colours to white except for the obvious ones, such as "duel arena ground" etc if you want to keep those.
[IMG]http://img200.imageshack.us/img200/2548/090905163831.png[/img]
[IMG]http://img200.imageshack.us/img200/5066/090905163838.png[/img]
Step 4 - Reloading Your Cache
When your done changing your colours you now may click at the bottom "Save Config", when your done that, it will say "archive repacked succesfully".
[IMG]http://img200.imageshack.us/img200/3589/090905163849.png[/img]
This may not be necissary, but i do it anyway, now Compile your client, and rune it and check out what was changed. If done correctly mostly all of the world will be white except for the mapdata grass etc.
PART TWO! - Creating your own 317 Mini Gw Arena!
Step 1 - Finding the area.
Ok log into your client and type ::tele 2054 3138.(or what ever your teleto command is) This will bring you to a huuuge open area, completly white if you did the above.
Step 2 - Creating your area.
Now you have this vast open large area to do whatever you want but for the sake of this tutorial, you can make yourself your own 317 mini gw arena.
Step 2.5:
This is very basic to do this, simply find cool, large objects that you want to make to border certain area's, and create a box. Do this in 4 different area's to create your 4 Godwar arena's.
Now simply spawn your npcs inside the box, and for your own methods, create a way so players can get into each
You can also make a mini pking box there as well if you wanted
Add a bank, anything you'd want.
NOTE - Since this is a client tutorial, i will not discuss how to go about adding objects and spawning npc's etc. There are many tutorial on this at www.moparisthebest.com/smf > server tutorials
I hope you enjoy'd my first tutorial on creating snowy grounds and a mini GW.
- Credits - Tom's suite Lin for seeing her client. Me for writting this Me for the idea You for reading and You for letting this stay here? :o
All pictures and tests, were used on my server and client (copyright to JaGex for their cache), and don't ask me any questions about items or npcs you may see on this server, as they were either already released by me, or removed because noobs didn't like them.
If you have any questions, feel free to ask.
BTW if i finish my GW ill post a picture of my result, wanna be creative as well? post your picture of your gw arena's from this tutorial so i can share with the world what it looks like :)
UPDATED PICTURES- [IMG]http://img29.imageshack.us/img29/8900/090907211401.png[/img] [IMG]http://img29.imageshack.us/img29/7001/090907211502.png[/img]

and many floors have different names/colours than they appear, so change as many as possible white.

item.title: [317] Changing ground Texture Colour/Create your own GW Area UPDATED PIX
item.dc:creator: @Tatemo Tatemo
item.description:
@Tatemo wrote:

[quote=“the1337legend, post:5, topic:300295”]mmmm and so i’ve realized, just there are a billion rocks + out there mmm
would recolouring it white through meta and overwriting that rocks model id with the new one work tho? ;O[/quote]

Yes if you recoloured every rock model.[quote=“Epic Ancient, post:7, topic:300295”]Lol wow. PAINTS KBD LAIR 2 WHITE
Now about that damned lava. X]

–CAN we make lava white? That would be epic as fuck.[/quote]

If you changed both lava textures to differing whites and greys[quote=“the1337legend, post:8, topic:300295”]hmmmm, i don’t think you could, and yes idk how to make grass white.

lava white…
hmmm you could try, very simply just go to the lava texture where ever it is and change the base colour white, although i doubt it would work or i’d have a snow cape by now

although u could change it to water :P[/quote]

Just change all the green ones to white.

[quote=“Epic Ancient, post:9, topic:300295”][quote author=the1337legend link=topic=396583.msg2945565#msg2945565 date=1252194532]
hmmmm, i don’t think you could, and yes idk how to make grass white.

lava white…
hmmm you could try, very simply just go to the lava texture where ever it is and change the base colour white, although i doubt it would work or i’d have a snow cape by now

although u could change it to water
[/quote]
How else would we get Ice Capes? Customs don’t do everything y’know. Animation of the cape had to require palette changing and custom-editing. Or something like that. ^^"[/quote]

You can add textures to items and texture changings through the ints I used to know which ints did it but my computer crashed and I lost all of it I had what all the ints did for objects items and npcs.

Read full topic

item.title: [317] Changing ground Texture Colour/Create your own GW Area UPDATED PIX
item.dc:creator: @the1337legend the1337legend
item.description:
@the1337legend wrote:

Welcome!:

Difficulty 1/10 (depends on your patience and lack of the ability to double click and select the white colour)

Equipment needed to use this:
-Tom’s Cache editor - http://www.nuke-net.com/?page_id=5
mirror 2: http://uppit.com/v/OXZC027G
-Your Client
-Your Cache

Step 1 - Loading your cache onto Tom’s Cache Editor:

-Loading your cache onto Tom’s Cache Editor is very easy, no skill required, simply Open the editor, and a small screen SHOULD pop up.
An easy route to get to open this is Cache-Suit>Trunk>Suite>Open Suite.jar.

Step 2 - Using the Cache editor

-Now at the top right, click, File, Load Cache, now go to your client, open client, then cache,now “OPEN” .file_store32, and now some option should open up on the editor such as “view/edit raw file system”.

-The one you want to click is quite obvious, View/Edit Floor Configuration, by the bottom.

Step 3 - Changing the Floor colour

Time for the fun part!

Now you should see a whooole bunch of options, cliff, cliff2, etc, every colour you see that looks gererally like the colour of the ground you want to change, click it and set then double click “colour” it might take a few times, till it becomes unhighlighed, then at the end you should see a “…” and a “x”, click the “…” and a small screen will popup
for quick changing, on the right hand side, where it says recent, just click any of those boxes to set the colour to white. Simply click ok, and continue.

I Suggest you change all the colours to white except for the obvious ones, such as “duel arena ground” etc if you want to keep those.

Step 4 - Reloading Your Cache

When your done changing your colours you now may click at the bottom “Save Config”, when your done that, it will say “archive repacked succesfully”.

This may not be necissary, but i do it anyway, now Compile your client, and rune it and check out what was changed. If done correctly mostly all of the world will be white except for the mapdata grass etc.

PART TWO! - Creating your own 317 Mini Gw Arena!

Step 1 - Finding the area.

Ok log into your client and type ::tele 2054 3138.(or what ever your teleto command is)
This will bring you to a huuuge open area, completly white
if you did the above.

Step 2 - Creating your area.

Now you have this vast open large area to do whatever you want
but for the sake of this tutorial, you can make yourself
your own 317 mini gw arena.

Step 2.5:

This is very basic to do this, simply find
cool, large objects that you want to make to border
certain area’s, and create a box.
Do this in 4 different area’s to create your 4
Godwar arena’s.

Now simply spawn your npcs inside the box, and for your
own methods, create a way so players can get into each

You can also make a mini pking box there as well if you wanted

Add a bank, anything you’d want.

NOTE -
Since this is a client tutorial, i will not discuss
how to go about adding objects and spawning npc’s etc.
There are many tutorial on this at www.moparisthebest.com/smf > server tutorials

I hope you enjoy’d my first tutorial on creating snowy grounds
and a mini GW.

  • Credits -
    Tom’s suite
    Lin for seeing her client.
    Me for writting this
    Me for the idea
    You for reading
    and You for letting this stay here? :o

All pictures and tests, were used on my server
and client (copyright to JaGex for their cache),
and don’t ask me any questions about items
or npcs you may see on this server, as they
were either already released by me, or removed
because noobs didn’t like them.

If you have any questions, feel free to ask.

BTW if i finish my GW ill post a picture of my result, wanna be creative as well? post your picture of your gw arena’s from this tutorial so i can share with the world what it looks like

UPDATED PICTURES-

Read full topic
